intro: Puccinellia parviflora, commonly known as small-flowered glassworts, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Amaranthaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in saline or alkaline soils, often found in coastal areas and salt marshes. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pink or red in color. It is adapted to tolerate high salinity and is often used in ecological restoration projects. Puccinellia parviflora plays an important role in stabilizing coastal environments and providing habitat for various small organisms.
